entries.description:
Requirements Your last action was a successful melee @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike}
that dealt damage against a target that is afflicted by a
poison, and you know which poison.

Poisons attack specific parts of the body-one venom might target the lungs, another the circulatory system, while another deteriorates the nerves. You know how to take advantage of such weaknesses.

You deal 1d6 damage of the required Strike's damage type and 1d6 poison damage to the target. If you're at least 18th level, you deal 2d6 damage of each type.

entries.name: Polearm Tricks
entries.description: Your connection to rune magic has revealed tricks to make polearms deadlier in your hands. You gain the critical specialization effects of polearms.

entries.name: Posse
entries.description:
Requirements You have designated prey with @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JYi4MnsdFu618hPm]{Hunt Prey}.

By spending 1 minute giving guidance to help hunt down your prey, you instruct up to five willing creatures to assist you. They gain a +1 circumstance bonus to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} your prey, to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} your prey, and to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} about your prey. You and the creatures assisting you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls when entering combat with your prey.

This benefit lasts until you designate a new prey or your prey dies, whichever comes first. An individual creature assisting you loses this benefit if they're out of your presence for too long to benefit from your instructions. This is usually 1 hour, but is determined by the GM.

entries.name: Poultice Preparation
entries.description:
When you create an herbal elixir, you can prepare it as a poultice instead. A poultice gains the oil trait (but remains alchemical, not magical) and loses the elixir and ingested traits. You can apply a poultice by @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacting} with one hand.

When you apply a poultice, in addition to the item's normal effects, the recipient can attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of persistent acid, bleed, or fire damage, with the DC reduction from appropriate assistance.

entries.name: Power Slide
entries.description:
Requirements You are piloting a vehicle.

You throw the vehicle into a barely controlled skid, turning sharply to evade pursuit or bring your weapons to bear. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.uS3qDAgOkZ7b8ERL]{Drive} with a -2 penalty to your piloting check, gaining the effects of the Drive action for the same number of actions you spent to Power Slide. At the end of the movement, if you succeed, you can turn the vehicle up to 90 degrees. If you critically succeed at your piloting check, you can instead turn the vehicle up to 180 degrees.

entries.name: Powerful Guts
entries.description: Your stomach is particularly durable. When you succeed at a Fortitude save to reduce your @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} value, you reduce it by 2 (or by 3 on a critical success).

entries.name: 力強き跳躍
entries.description:
前提条件　〈運動〉に熟練

君が「跳躍」する際、君は垂直方向に５フィート跳躍することが出来る。また、水平方向に跳躍する距離を５フィート増加させることが出来る。

entries.name: Practiced Defender
entries.description: After extensive practice with the Swords, you're comfortable enough with your shield to move at a normal pace with it raised. You may use the Defend exploration activity while traveling at your full travel speed instead of half your travel speed.

entries.name: Practiced Guidance
entries.description: Making one's way to safety can be harrowing, but you have extensive practice at helping others along that path. When you roll a success to Aid a member of your crop, you get a critical success instead.

entries.name: Practiced Paddler
entries.description: You're skilled at navigating bogs and marshes, even for a paddler shoony. You gain a swim Speed of 15 feet.

entries.name: Practiced Reloads
entries.description: You've mastered the reloading techniques and methods usually practiced by only the most dedicated firearm professionals. You gain the slinger's reload for the way you selected with Gunslinger's Dedication.

entries.name: Prayer Attack
entries.description:
Requirements You are wielding a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.wkzxLpSe7LN6c5Ld]{Sawtooth Saber} in each hand.

You've mastered the signature assassination style of the Red Mantis. Attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} an enemy within 30 feet. If your Feint is successful, when you use Prayer Attack on subsequent turns you automatically make the target flat-footed against your melee attacks for that turn without rolling a check to Feint, so as long as you remain visible to the target and the target remains within 30 feet of you. If you use your Prayer Attack against a different target, you must attempt to Feint the target normally.

When you use Prayer Attack, your next successful Strike with a sawtooth saber that turn deals [[/r 2d6 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} to the target.

entries.name: Precious Arrow
entries.description:
You enchant a piece of ammunition with the magical essence of a precious material, allowing you to leverage certain creatures' weaknesses.

Choose cold iron or silver; if you shoot the arrow before the end of your turn, it counts as that material. At 14th level, add adamantine to the list of materials you can choose from.

entries.name: 稀少な弾薬
entries.description:
前提条件　《弾薬整備士》

君は旅で集めてきた稀少素材の破片を混ぜ合わせて、一時的な矢弾にそれらの属性をもたらすカスタム弾を作る。君は標準クラスのアダマンティン、冷たい鉄、錬金術銀の矢弾を作り出すために上級錬金術を使い、矢弾1つに対して1回分の試薬を消費する。15レベル時点で、君は高級クラスのアダマンティン、冷たい鉄、錬金術銀の矢弾を作ることが出来る。

entries.name: Predator's Growl
entries.description:
Trigger You successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} a hidden or undetected creature.

You give a throaty growl to attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a creature you just found. You don't take the -4 penalty for not sharing a language with the creature.

entries.name: Preemptive Reconfiguration
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You would take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

Your body anticipates the blow. The impact area briefly reorganizes into a strengthened tissue lattice that blunts the attack. You gain resistance equal to your level to the triggering damage type, which applies against the triggering damage.

If you have the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.Ewk7h9aQpKvy1RJo]{Crystalline Dust} feat, you can use Preemptive Reconfiguration without expending a usage of the reaction for the purpose of the feat’s Frequency limit. Instead, the usage counts toward your number of Crystalline Dust uses per day, as if you had used that feat instead.

entries.name: 有事の備え
entries.description:
前提条件　《先見の明》

君は前もって、必要になるかもしれない消耗品を予測することが出来る。《先見の明》を使う際、君は、冒険用の装備の代わりに背負い袋から消耗品アイテムを調達することが出来る。消耗品アイテムは君のレベルの半分以下のコモンのアイテムでなければならず、バルクは、そのアイテムを運搬することによって、君が過積載にならない程度に軽くなければならない。

entries.name: 先見の明
entries.description:
コスト 選んだアイテムの価格

条件 最後に雑貨を買うことが出来た最期の時にこの能力を使っていない

君は、それを可能とする自身の資源を用いて、定期的に、入り組んだ計画と緊急用の予備計画を作り出す。君は背負い袋を取るのに1分をかけ、それから、注意深く、君が事前に宣言していない、君が購入したアイテムを取り出す――君は直感的に、そのアイテムが必要になるということを知っていて、最後の機会にそれを購入していたのである。

そのアイテムは冒険用具でなければならず、武器、防具、錬金術アイテム、魔法のアイテム、あるいはその他の宝物であってはならない。

そのアイテムは君のレベルの半分以下のコモンのアイテムでなければならず、バルクは君がそれを運搬することによって過積載にならない程度に軽くなければならない。

entries.name: Preternatural Parry
entries.description:
Trigger You're targeted by a Strike or a spell attack roll, or you're about to roll a saving throw against a spell effect.

Requirements You have one or more hands free.

You snap your weapon or limb into place to ward off harm at the last second. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws against the triggering effect until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Prevailing Position
entries.description:
Trigger You are targeted by an attack or attempt a Reflex saving throw against a damaging effect, and you are in a stance.

Your willingness to flow from one stance to another lets you sacrifice their benefits to better protect yourself.

You leave the stance you were in, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering saving throw or to your AC against the triggering attack.

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.COsdMolZraFRTdP8]{Feat Effect: Prevailing Position}

entries.name: Pride Hunter
entries.description: You avoid the attention of creatures focused on your allies. You can use lesser cover from your allies to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}.

entries.name: Pride in Arms
entries.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet brings a foe to 0 Hit Points.

With a shout of triumph, you grant inspiration to an ally fight on. The triggering ally gains temporary Hit Points equal to their Constitution modifier until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Primal Breadth
entries.description: Increase the spell slots you gain from druid archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest spell slots.

entries.name: Primal Rampage
entries.description: You tap into the unstoppable, primeval strength of your ancient kin. You gain @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Freedom of Movement} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2BV2yYPfVJ5zirZt]{Stoneskin} as 4th-level primal innate spells that you can cast once per day. As a 3-action activity, you can Cast a Spell twice to cast both of these innate spells, as long as they are both still available for the day.

entries.name: Propeller Attachment
entries.description: You've mastered attaching clockwork propellers to your daily quick-deploy snares that use gears. This allows you to place your snares in the air or underwater, where they remain in place for up to 10 minutes, after which the propeller runs out of power and they fall or sink. Unless you use additional precautions to hide it, a propeller snare's location is usually obvious.

entries.name: Protect Ally
entries.description: You place your body between your friends and your enemies, protecting your allies against oncoming attacks. You choose one adjacent ally. That ally gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn or until that ally is no longer adjacent to you, whichever comes first. You can only protect a single ally in this way. If you choose to Protect a different Ally, the previous ally loses the bonus to AC.

entries.name: Protective Bond
entries.description:
Trigger You and your eidolon are in a damaging effect's area.

The power of your bond can protect you and your eidolon from harm. If you and your eidolon would take different amounts of damage from the area effect, you take the lower amount of damage instead of the greater amount of damage.

Special This feat has the trait matching your eidolon's tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

entries.name: Protective Claws
entries.description: The chitin on your claws is so hard you can defend against attacks with them. Your claw unarmed attack from the vicious goloma heritage gains the parry weapon trait.

entries.name: Protective Subroutine
entries.description: Your nanites can augment your defenses. You can choose to activate @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.JS24EjgLYcHB9E3T]{Nanite Surge} when you attempt a saving throw, instead of when you attempt a skill check. If you do, you gain a +2 status bonus to the triggering saving throw.

entries.name: 試作品の相棒
entries.description: 君は人造の相棒を作り出した。これは発明ではないが、信頼できる手下として機能する。君はプロトタイプの人造の相棒を手に入れる。

entries.name: Provocator Dedication
entries.description:
Access Successfully defeat the eberarks in the Irorium.

For you, fighting is as much about style as skill. You become trained in simple weapons, martial weapons, and one advanced weapon of your choice. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using your chosen advanced weapon, you also apply the critical specialization of that weapon. You become an expert in Performance and your choice of either Acrobatics or Athletics. If you were an expert in all three of these skills, you instead become an expert in a skill of your choice.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the provocator archetype.

entries.name: Proximity Alert
entries.description: You’re unnaturally in tune with your surroundings and react instinctively to danger. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks made as initiative rolls.

entries.name: Purge Sins
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You call on your celestial forebears to rid your body of all toxins and impurities. For each disease or poison currently affecting you, attempt a Religion check to counteract that disease or poison. As normal, your counteract level is equal to half your level, rounded up.

entries.name: Purifying Spell
entries.description: You purify the water within a creature's body to cleanse them of illness. If the next action you use is to cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} targeting a single living creature, you can attempt to counteract a disease or poison affecting the target, in addition to the other benefits of heal. If you do, heal gains the water trait.

entries.name: Push It
entries.description: You can push your vehicle's performance beyond the limits envisioned by its makers. Whenever you succeed at a piloting check, the vehicle you are piloting gains a +5-foot circumstance bonus to all its Speeds until the end of your turn. If you critically succeed, this bonus increases to +10 feet.

entries.name: Pushing Attack
entries.description: Your eidolon has an attack that pushes away enemies. Choose one of the eidolon's unarmed attacks with the shove trait. It gains the @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.t6cx9FOODmeZQNYl]{Push} action for that attack.

entries.name: Qlippoth Magic
entries.description: You’ve deeply studied the secrets of your blood and can force reality to act against its own wishes. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

entries.name: Quadruped
entries.description:
You were crafted in a form with four legs rather than two. Your Speed is 30 feet.

Special You can take this feat only at 1st level, and you can't retrain into or out of this feat.

entries.name: Quick Alchemy
entries.description: You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.yzNJgwzV9XqEhKc6]{Quick Alchemy} action.

entries.name: Quick Change (Beastkin)
entries.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

Your instincts kick in and you take on an aggressive stance. You use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.0b3TTeQGFOiy6ykz]{Change Shape} to enter your hybrid form or a new form granted by a beastkin feat.

entries.name: Quick Change (Vigilante)
entries.description: You can shift between your identities with ease. Instead of spending 1 minute to change your identity, you can now do so as a 3-action activity. If you are legendary in Deception, you can perform this change as a 1-action activity.

entries.name: 登攀高速化
entries.description:
前提条件　〈運動〉に達人

「登攀」する際、君は成功時に５フィート、クリティカルで10フィート多く、最大で君の速度まで移動することが出来る。もし君が〈運動〉に伝説なら、君は速度に等しい登攀速度を得る。

entries.name: 素早いコネ作り
entries.description:
前提条件　《コネクション》あるいは《犯罪のコネ》；〈社会〉に熟練

君は、素早く新しいコネを作るのに、どこへ行き、誰と話し、どうするべきかを知っている。新しい居住地に入ってすぐに、1日の余暇を費やすことで、君は《コネクション》あるいは《犯罪社会のコネ》で使うのに十分なコネを作ることが出来る。もし、君が〈社会〉に伝説なら、君は新しい居住地に入って1時間以内に必要なコネを作ることが出来る。

entries.name: 素早い変装
entries.description:
前提条件　〈欺瞞〉に熟練

君は通常の時間の半分（一般的には5分）で変装を行うことが出来る。もし君が達人なら、通常の時間の1/10（大抵は1分）である。もし君が伝説なら、君は3アクションの連続行動として、完全な変装を作り出し、「なりすます」ことが出来る。

entries.name: Quick Fix
entries.description:
You can attach a talisman using only a bit of glue and some string. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.x9xA8P2Vlz98He7C]{Rapid Affixture} skill feat, even if you don't meet the prerequisites. When you use it, you can affix or remove up to four talismans in 1 minute instead of just one.

You gain the ability to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UAaQk93a30nx0nYY]{Affix a Talisman} as a 3-action activity from that feat at 12th level, regardless of your Crafting proficiency.

entries.name: Quick Juggler
entries.description: When you start to juggle or add another item to those you are Juggling, you add two items instead of one. Increase the maximum number of items you can Juggle by one.

entries.name: 高速騎乗
entries.description:
前提条件　キャヴァリアーの専心；〈自然〉に熟練

条件 君が、少なくとも自分より1サイズ大きく、君の乗騎になることに同意するクリーチャーに隣接している

君と君の乗騎は瞬時に行動を起こすことが出来る。君はそのクリーチャーに@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{「騎乗」}し、選んだ命令をするための@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{「動物使い」}を使う。

entries.name: 呪文識別高速化
entries.description:
前提条件　〈神秘学〉〈自然〉〈霊妙学〉あるいは〈宗教〉に達人

君は即座に“呪文の識別”を使う。1ラウンドに1回、君は自分が達人である技能を使って@Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.MjQyTcV8Jiv1Jtln]{「呪文の識別」}をフリー・アクションで使うことが出来る。

entries.name: Quick Shot
entries.description: You draw your bow and attack with the same action. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to draw a weapon from the bow weapon group that is loaded or has reload 0, then @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} with that weapon.

entries.name: 入り込み高速化
entries.description:
前提条件　〈軽業〉に修得

君は1ラウンドに5フィート（クリティカルで10フィート）、「無理やり入り込む」。もし君が〈軽業〉に伝説なら、完全な速度で「無理やり入り込む」ことが出来る。

entries.name: Quick Stow (Ratfolk)
entries.description:
Frequency once per round

You are adept at quickly moving items into your cheek pouches. You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interact} to store one held item in your cheek pouches (provided it fits).

entries.name: Quick Stow (Swordmaster)
entries.description: You know that situations can change rapidly and might leave you needing to change equipment in the middle of combat. Your training has taught you how to swap your equipment on the fly. You Interact to stow a weapon and then Interact again to draw a readied item or weapon.

entries.name: Quick Study
entries.description:
During your daily preparations, you can study a particular subject to gain the trained proficiency rank in one Lore skill of your choice. You must have interacted with that subject in some way on the previous day, whether by reading about it, talking to someone knowledgeable on the topic, or experiencing it yourself.

Alternatively, you can reference your notes to instead choose a Lore skill you've prepared before with Quick Study. This proficiency lasts until you prepare again. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option like a feat.

entries.name: 水泳高速化
entries.description:
前提条件　〈運動〉に達人

君は成功時に5フィート、クリティカル時に10フィート、ただし君の速度の最大値まで、より多く「水泳」することが出来る。もし君が〈運動〉に伝説なら、君は速度に等しい水泳速度を得る。

entries.name: 素早い鍵開け
entries.description:
前提条件　〈窃盗〉に達人

君は2アクションではなく1アクションを使って“鍵開け”することが出来る。

entries.name: Quicken Heartbeat
entries.description:
Frequency once per turn<

You've replaced your heart with one made of animated quicksilver and living adamantine. You reduce your @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition by 1. Alternatively, if you are not slowed, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 during your next turn, and can use your extra action to Stride or Strike.

entries.name: Quickened Attunement
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Your previous action was Attunement Shift.

If your next action is to cast a spell that would grant your terrain attunement bonus, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (to a minimum of 1 action).

Special You can't use Quickened Attunement and @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.z2ptq23nNBOeEI7H]{Quickened Casting} in the same round.

entries.name: ひそかな味方
entries.description:
前提条件　〈隠密〉に熟練

君は集団での移動に長けている。君が「隠密移動」しており、君の味方が「専門家にならう」を行っているのんら、君とその味方はそれぞれロールするのではなく、最も低い修せ値を用いて一回の〈隠密〉判定をロールすることが出来る。これはイニシアチブ・ロールには適用されない。

entries.name: Quill Spray
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You can launch a mass of quills at opponents. You spray quills in a 30-foot cone, dealing [[/r 5d8 #piercing]] piercing damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a basic saving throw against the higher of your class DC or spell DC. On a critical failure, a creature also takes [[/r 5 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}. At 11th level and every even level thereafter, the piercing damage increases by 1d8 and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

[[/r ceil(@details.level.value/2)d8 #piercing]]{Levelled} piercing damage

[[/r ceil(@details.level.value/2) #persistent bleed]]{Levelled} @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}

entries.name: Radiant Burst
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Your skin glows with intensity. Creatures within 10 feet who can see you must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and dazzled for 4 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature is blinded for 4 rounds and dazzled for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Radiant Circuitry
entries.description: Your biological circuitry emits light like a torch, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet). The light shuts off when you take this action again or are knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

entries.name: Radiate Glory
entries.description:
Your inherent glory radiates into the world with all the divine power of the celestial planes for 1 minute.

Any creature that can see you while you Radiate Glory must attempt a Will saving throw against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success You are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the creature for 1 round by the shining light, but can’t use this concealment to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, as normal for when your location is obvious.

Failure As success, except you are concealed to the creature while your glory radiates.

Critical Failure You are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to the creature while your glory radiates, lost amid the radiant corona of your presence. Your general position is still obvious, so you can’t use this to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

entries.name: Rain of Bolts
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Throughout the day, your body produces powerful projectiles within your chassis. You fire them all at once in either a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]{30-foot cone} or a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10-foot emanation}. Foes in the area take [[/r {6d6}[piercing]]]{6d6 piercing damage}. This increases to 7d6 at 12th level, 8d6 at 15th level, and 9d6 at 18th level.

Enhancement The projectiles regenerate quicker, they are much more powerful, and you can refine the metallic content to harm certain creatures. You can use Rain of Bolts once per hour instead of once per day. The damage increases to 12d6 and each time you use the action, you can choose adamantine, cold iron, or silver. The damage from Rain of Bolts is treated as the metal you chose. At 20th level, the damage increases to 13d6.

entries.name: Rain of Embers Stance
entries.description:
Requirements You are unarmored.

You enter the stance of an enraged phoenix, holding your fingers as rigid as deadly talons while moving with quick, flickering gestures that flicker with dancing flames. The only Strikes you can make are fire talon Strikes. These deal 1d4 fire damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, finesse, fire, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

While in Rain of Embers Stance, you gain a +1 status bonus to AC and fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1).

@Compendium[pf2e.feat-effects.Im5JBInybWFbHEYS]{Stance: Rain of Embers Stance}

entries.name: Rain-Scribe Mobility
entries.description: You surround yourself in a mantle of Rain-Scribe magic and Stride twice; difficult terrain does not reduce your Speed, even if the difficult terrain has been manipulated by magic. Your magic clears the difficult terrain in each square you entered; until your next turn, those squares aren't difficult terrain for any creature walking through them (or are normal difficult terrain if they were previously greater difficult terrain).

entries.name: Rain-Scribe Sustenance
entries.description:
You use the power of your Rain-Scribe magic to draw on a stream of primal power for sustenance. You don't need to eat or drink and need only 6 hours of rest to feel well rested. You must still rest at least 8 hours and spend 1 hour of preparation to regain resources usable only a limited number of times per day, such as spell slots.

You can draw on primal power to stay awake and alert while otherwise resting your body and mind, gaining the full benefits of an 8-hour rest without falling asleep. When you do, you lose the other benefits of Rain- Scribe Sustenance for 1 week while your primal energies recharge.

entries.name: Raise a Tome
entries.description:
Requirements You're holding a book.

You raise up the book you're holding and flip it open to defend yourself and expedite your studies. The book remains raised until the start of your next turn. While you have a book raised, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge to identify creatures using a skill related to the subject of the book (Arcana if you're using your spellbook). This bonus is in addition to any item bonus the book normally gives to the check.

If you have @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block}, you can use the tome for that feat (Hardness 3, HP 12, BT 6) as though it were a shield. Whenever you use an ability that allows you to Raise a Shield, such as Emergency Targe, you can Raise a Tome instead, changing any requirements that normally require a shield to apply to your book.

entries.name: Rakshasa Magic
entries.description: You remember the secrets of your rakshasa forebears and know how to apply those memories to get results. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature} once per day each as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

entries.name: Rallying Charge
entries.description:
Your fearless charge into battle reinvigorates your allies to carry on the fight.

You @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} up to your Speed and make a melee @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike}. If your Strike hits and damages an enemy, each ally within 60 feet who saw you hit gains temporary Hit Points equal to your Charisma modifier. These temporary Hit Points last until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rallying Cry
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You call out to your allies and push them to give their all in combat. All allies within 30 feet that can hear you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level. In addition, these allies become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute but can only use the extra action to Step, Stride, or Strike.

entries.name: Rampaging Form
entries.description:
Once per day, when you Change Shape into a fox, you can instead gain the effects of both the canine form of 5th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} and 7th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XS7Wyh5YC0NWeWyB]{Fiery Body} for 1 minute or until you shift back, whichever comes first. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame} from the fiery body effect even though you’re in a battle form.

Special If you are a frozen wind kitsune, your form is ice instead of fire. This changes the immunity and damage from the fiery body effect to cold, changes the weakness to fire, and changes produce flame to @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost}.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant
entries.description:
Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

When you select this feat, choose a damage type: acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, negative, piercing, positive, or slashing. If your eidolon is a celestial, fiend, or monitor with an alignment other than true neutral, you can choose a damage type in its alignment.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Acid)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 acid damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Bludgeoning)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Chaotic)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 chaotic damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Cold)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 cold damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Electricity)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 electricity damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Evil)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 evil damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Fire)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 fire damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Good)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 good damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Lawful)
entries.description:
Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

When you select this feat, choose a damage type: acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, negative, piercing, positive, or slashing. If your eidolon is a celestial, fiend, or monitor with an alignment other than true neutral, you can choose a damage type in its alignment.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Negative)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 negative damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Piercing)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 piercing damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Positive)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 positive damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Combatant (Slashing)
entries.description: Spines, flame jets, and holy blasts are just some of the ways your eidolon might strike from a distance. It gains a ranged unarmed attack with a range increment of 30 feet that deals 1d4 slashing damage and has the magical and propulsive traits.

entries.name: Ranged Disarm
entries.description:
Requirements You're wielding a simple firearm.

When using a simple firearm, you can shoot objects right out of your enemy's hands. Attempt to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the target using a ranged attack roll with your simple firearm, instead of attempting an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC.

entries.name: Ranger Dedication
entries.description:
You become trained in Survival; if you were already trained in Survival, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You become trained in ranger class DC. You can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JYi4MnsdFu618hPm]{Hunt Prey} action.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the ranger archetype.

entries.name: Ranger Resiliency
entries.description: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting ranger archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.

entries.name: Rapid Manifestation
entries.description:
Trigger You roll initiative or a hazard attacks you.

Your unwavering soul brings up your defenses as soon as you're in danger. You Manifest your Soulforged Armament.

entries.name: かじりつき高速化
entries.description:
前提条件　〈運動〉に熟練

君は簡単に自分を崖の上に引き上げる。君が「かじりつく」際、その地面に君は自分を引き上げ、立つことが出来る。君は「かじりつく」ための反応セーヴの代わりに〈運動〉を使うことが出来る。

entries.name: Rapid Recharge
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You tap into an arcane trick to recover your ability to meld spells and attacks. You recharge your Spellstrike.

entries.name: Rat Familiar
entries.description: You have a pet rat that has become magically bonded to you. You gain a familiar, and this familiar must be a rat. It still gets the benefits of familiar abilities, but its base form remains a rat.

entries.name: Rat Form
entries.description: You can transform into an innocuous-looking rat to scout an area or slip through tight spaces. You gain the effects of a 1st-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell, except that you must assume the battle form of a Tiny rat.

entries.name: Rat Magic
entries.description: There always seems to be a little rat around to carry messages for you. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.yhz9fF69uwRhnHix]{Animal Messenger} once per day as a primal innate spell. When you do, the animal that responds is always a rat. If there are no rats within range, the spell is lost.

entries.name: Ratfolk Growth
entries.description: You call upon the familial bonds you share with other ysoki to defend them in battle. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} as a 6th-level primal innate spell once per day. You can target only yourself and other ratfolk with this spell.

entries.name: Ratfolk Lore
entries.description:
Years of experience among ratfolk communities have made you nimble, and you've learned to run and hide when enemies threaten.

You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Ratfolk Lore.

entries.name: Ratfolk Roll
entries.description: Your ability to curl up into a tight ball comes in handy. You roll up into a ball and move up to four times your Speed in a straight line down an incline. If you reach the bottom of the incline or hit an obstacle during this first turn of movement, you stop rolling safely. Otherwise, you automatically keep rolling at this Speed during subsequent turns until you hit the bottom of the incline or an obstacle ends this movement (which can happen in the middle of your turn). You’re @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} 2 each turn after the first that you keep rolling, and if you hit an obstacle on a turn after the first, you and the obstacle both take [[/r 4d6 #bludgeoning]] bludgeoning damage and you stop rolling.

entries.name: Ratspeak
entries.description:
To you, the squeaking of rats and other rodents makes a strange kind of sense.

You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with rodents, including beavers, mice, porcupines, rats, and squirrels, but not with other mammals, such as dogs or bats. The GM determines which animals count as rodents.

entries.name: Razor Claws
entries.description: Your have honed your claws to be deadly. Your claw attack deals [[/r 1d6 #slashing]] slashing damage instead of 1d4 and gains the versatile (piercing) trait.

entries.name: Reach Beyond
entries.description: You've learned to move your spiritual energy past yourself to attack spirits where others can't. You can make melee Strikes against incorporeal creatures that are inside solid objects as long as the object is within your reach. An incorporeal creature inside of a solid object is hidden, requiring you to succeed at a DC 11 flat check when you target it. You can spend an action, which has the concentrate trait, to focus on a creature inside of a solid object. If you do, the next melee Strike you make this turn requires you to succeed at only a DC 6 flat check to affect the creature.

entries.name: Reach for the Sky
entries.description:
Requirements You're wielding a loaded firearm.

You command the room, firing a gun into the air and ordering everyone to surrender and put their hands in the air. You fire your firearm and then attempt a single Intimidation check to Demoralize each enemy within 30 feet. Creatures who become frightened instinctively put their hands in the air. If they had Raised a Shield, they lose the benefits, as they raise the shield above their head where it's of little use to block attacks. With their hands in the air, each of these frightened creatures can't use reactions or free actions that require their hands, or items held in their hands, until the beginning of their next turn. Regardless of the result, each creature is then temporarily immune to Reach for the Sky for 1 minute.

entries.name: 星への跳躍
entries.description:
前提条件　《黒色火薬のブースト跳躍》

十分な黒色火薬さえ持っていれば、空だけが君の限界である。「黒色火薬のブースト跳躍」を使う際、更に遠くへ跳ぶために追加の黒色火薬や矢弾を消費することが出来る。追加で消費した黒色火薬1回分あるいは火器の矢弾１つごとに、@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{「跳躍」}の高さや距離を更に10フィート追加することが出来る。最大で5回のブーストをかけることが可能である（5回で＋50フィートのステータス・ボーナス）。君はブーストのために爆発をさせるには、黒色火薬や矢弾を着用しているか、手の中に持っている必要がある。君は「跳躍」のどの時点でブーストさせるかを選ぶことが出来る。つまり、君はブーストするごとに方向を変えることが出来る。再度ブーストするか、「跳躍」を終えるまで、君は直線で移動しなくてはならない。

entries.name: Reactive Charm
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You are the target of a spell or attack.

You're so charming and distracting that when pressed, you can cast a simple enchantment in time to foil an attacker. You cast any of your 1st-level enchantment spells that normally take two actions or fewer to cast. This takes effect before the triggering spell or attack, and if the attacker is affected by your spell, it can make different decisions based on the effects (for instance, if you charm the attacker and it becomes friendly to you, it can choose a different target than you for its attack or spell). The attacking creature must be in range of your chosen spell, and if your spell requires targets, the attacking creature must be a valid target. Your spell affects only the attacking creature, even if it would normally affect more targets or an area.

entries.name: Reactive Dismissal
entries.description:
Trigger Your eidolon would take damage.

You abruptly dismiss your eidolon to reduce the damage it takes, though this makes summoning it again more difficult. Reduce the triggering damage to your eidolon by double your level, and your eidolon unmanifests. You can't Manifest your Eidolon again until after the end of your next turn.

entries.name: 言語解析
entries.description:
前提条件　言語学者の専心；〈社会〉に達人

全てのコミュニケーションには、僅かなサインや兆候が満ちている。もし、誰かと少なくとも10分以上、接しているなら、君はその地方の言葉や発音の変化、非言語の手がかりから、社会的環境、つまり故郷や所属している特定のグループについての些細な事実を知ることが出来る。

もし、庶民が貴族の振りをしているなど、この能力の対象が社会的環境について嘘をついているなら、対象は君の〈社会〉DCに対して〈欺瞞〉、〈社会〉、あるいは適切な〈伝承〉判定に成功しなくてはならない。成功した場合には、仮定した正体に一致する偽の些細な事実を君に提供する。

ひとたび、ある人物について1つ以上の本当の些細な事実を把握したなら、その様式を話し方に取り入れ、相手が親しみを感じるような方法で自分を表現することが出来るようになる。これによって、相手への〈交渉〉と〈欺瞞〉判定に+1状況ボーナスを得られる。

entries.name: Read The Stars
entries.description: You’re incredibly skilled in iruxi astrology, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars’ alignment. Once per night, if you can clearly see the stars, you can spend 1 hour reading the heavens to see how they relate to a particular goal, event, or activity that will occur within 1 week. The GM rolls a secret check, either a DC 28 Astrology Lore check or a DC 32 Occultism check. On a success, you learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, and on a critical failure, you learn a misleading cryptic clue or piece of advice.

entries.name: Read the Land
entries.description: You've learned how to commune with the land to learn information. You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.l4LFwY7iuzX6sDXr]{Commune with Nature} ritual if you didn't know it already. You can perform this ritual with a casting time of 1 hour instead of 1 day and without a secondary caster.

entries.name: Reanimating Spark
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You have the dying condition and are about to attempt a recovery check.

The magic that animates you strains to keep you alive. You're restored to 1 Hit Point, lose the dying and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions, and can act normally on this turn. You gain or increase the wounded condition as normal when losing the dying condition in this way.

entries.name: Reaper of Repose
entries.description: Your skill and fervor allow you to pierce undead defenses and exploit their weaknesses. When you make an attack using a weapon with which you have master proficiency and hit an undead creature, you ignore 5 points of the creature's resistances, and the undead's weaknesses are 2 higher against your attack.

entries.name: Reassuring Presence
entries.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet gains the frightened condition.

You serve as an anchor to your close companions, calming them in times of stress. Decrease the value of the triggering ally’s @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition by 1. The ally is then temporarily immune to your Reassuring Presence for 1 hour.

entries.name: リバウンド強襲
entries.description:
条件 君が装填済みの火器や装填済みのクロスボウを一本の手で使っており、別の手で殴打あるいは斬撃近接武器を使っている

君は、君は敵に近接武器を投げつけた後、武器の柄に弾丸を撃ち込み、追加ダメージを与えて手元に戻す。その近接武器で投擲遠隔「打撃」を行い、それから火器で遠隔「打撃」を行う。両方の「打撃」は同じ複数回攻撃ペナルティを使う。もし、近接武器が投擲の特性を持っていないなら、「リバウンド強襲」の間、投擲10フィートの特性を得る。

もし、両方の攻撃が成功したなら、ボルトあるいは弾は対象ではなく投擲近接武器に命中し、その攻撃の勢いを強める。双方の「打撃」によるダメージを合算すること。投擲武器のダメージ種別を使い、[[/r {1d6}[精密]]]{1d6点の精密ダメージ}を加える。この衝撃は近接武器を対象からリバウンドさせ、君の手に戻す。

両方の攻撃が命中した以外のあらゆる状況においては、個々の「打撃」を通常通りに処理する。投擲武器はリバウンドせず、投擲武器の通常のルール通りに対象の接敵面に残る。

entries.name: Recognize Ambush
entries.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

Your combat training has honed you to be ready for an attack at all times. You Interact to draw a weapon.

entries.name: 脅威の認識
entries.description:
前提条件　「知識を思い出す」の技能に達人；パスファインダー協会の調査員の専心

入手手段　パスファインダー協会の一員であるキャラクターがこのオプションの入手手段を持つ

条件 君がトリガーとなったクリーチャーの識別のための技能に達人の習熟度を持つ

トリガー 遭遇における君の最初の手番が開始し、君がクリーチャーを見ることが出来る

君は、チームに情報を伝えることが出来るように、素早く脅威を見積もる。トリガーとなったクリーチャーに対して「知識を思い出す」判定を試みる。

entries.name: 忘れ得ぬ知識
entries.description:
前提条件　剣の達人の専心；「知識を思い出す」の技能に熟練

条件 君が、自分のレベル以下で、かつ、君が熟練である技能の「知識を思い出す」で識別可能かもしれないクリーチャーと戦っている

君は研究の間、注意を払い、様々なクリーチャーに攻撃する正しい方法を覚えている。条件に合致するクリーチャーを1体、選ぶ。君は、「知識を思い出す」に成功する必要なく、そのクリーチャー（君が選んだ）の抵抗、耐性、弱点を知る。

entries.name: Recover Spell
entries.description:
Requirements An enemy's action disrupted your attempts to Cast a Spell since the beginning of your last turn.

You recover the energy of a recently disrupted spell, allowing you to cast it again as long as you do so immediately before the energy dissipates. You regain the use of a spell that was disrupted since the beginning of your last turn, but you must immediately Cast the Spell again with your next action or else you lose the spell; as normal for metamagic, this must be on the same turn that you use Recover Spell. You can change the area, targets, and other variables, including the number of actions used to Cast the Spell if the spell allows, such as when casting @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}.

entries.name: Recycled Cogwheels
entries.description: You're able to scavenge the cogwheels from your daily quick-deploy snares that use gears. This allows you to deconstruct a snare that didn't trigger in order to set the snare up somewhere else. Doing so takes the same number of actions as setting the snare did. When you do, you recover the snare and can deploy it in another location.

entries.name: Red Mantis Assassin Dedication
entries.description:
Access You are from Mediogalti Island.

You have learned how to stalk your foes and slay them with a sawtooth sabre. You become trained in Stealth and Assassin Lore; if you were already trained, you become an expert instead. Whenever your proficiency in any weapon increases to expert or beyond, you also gain that new proficiency with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.wkzxLpSe7LN6c5Ld]{Sawtooth Saber}.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Red Mantis assassin archetype.

entries.name: Redirect Elements
entries.description:
Trigger The spell attack roll for a foe's spell with an elemental trait targeting you fails or critically fails.

You seize the elemental essence of an incoming spell and redirect the spell to a creature of your choice within the spell's area. The attacker rerolls the spell's attack roll against the new target.

entries.name: 導きの一射
entries.description:
トリガー 投擲武器あるいは矢弾を使った遠隔攻撃を味方が失敗する。その味方は君の補助を受け入れることに同意しており、君の火器あるいはクロスボウの最初の射程単位以内にいなければならない

条件 君が装填済み火器あるいはクロスボウを使っている

味方の攻撃がさまよいかけたところを見て、君は軌道を正すために武器を発射する。火器を発射し、d20をロールする。君の味方は自分のロールではなく、このロールを攻撃ロールの出目として使う。また、この攻撃は劣った遮蔽あるいは普通の遮蔽によって対象が得ているボーナスを無視する。

entries.name: Reflecting Riposte
entries.description:
Trigger An opponent casts a spell and you critically succeed at a saving throw against it.

Requirements You have a shield raised or are benefiting from Dueling Parry or Twin Parry.

You attempt to counteract the triggering spell using powerful magical techniques observed in the Kortos Mounts. Use your attack roll modifier with your shield or parrying weapon for your counteract check. If you counteract the spell, it is reflected upon the caster. If the spell targeted individual creatures, it targets the caster only. If the spell targeted an area centered on a point, the new area is centered on the caster. If the spell was a cone or line, the cone or line emanates from you toward the caster. If the spell has a save DC, it uses your class DC, and if it requires a spell attack roll, use the same attack roll modifier as the counteract check.

entries.name: Reflective Ripple Stance
entries.description:
Requirements You're unarmored.

You enter a stance of fluid grace as small amounts of water flow with your movements and attacks. You can make flowing wave attacks that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the agile, disarm, finesse, nonlethal, trip, unarmed, and water traits.

While in Reflective Ripple Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip}, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC to avoid being Disarmed and Tripped.

Special This feat gains your choice of either the divine or occult trait, matching your ki spell tradition if possible.

entries.name: Reflexive Catch
entries.description:
Requirements The item or thrown weapon is of a Bulk you can Juggle. If the trigger was a thrown weapon attack targeting you, you can't be flat-footed to the attack. If you were already Juggling, you can't be Juggling your maximum number of items.

Trigger An item falls within your reach or an attacker fails an attack roll to hit you or a creature within your reach with a thrown weapon.

You grab the triggering item. If you are Juggling, you can immediately add the item to the objects you're Juggling as a free action, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits.

entries.name: Reflexive Grip
entries.description: You keep hold of your weapons even when knocked out. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when defending against checks to Disarm you. In addition, when you fall unconscious, you don't drop any weapons that you're currently wielding, though somebody else can remove them from you.

entries.name: Regrowth
entries.description: Your command over your vital essence allows you or an ally to recover from grievous wounds. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate} as a 7th-level primal innate spell once per day.

entries.name: Rehydration
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You surround your body with a thin layer of water drawn from the moisture in the air. You can spend one hour resting to rehydrate your gills and skin, which counts as submerging your body in water. At the GM’s discretion, incredibly dry areas, such as deserts, might not have enough moisture in the air for your Rehydration to work.

entries.name: Reinforce Eidolon
entries.description: You buffer your eidolon. You gain the reinforce eidolon link cantrip.

entries.name: Reinforced Chassis
entries.description:
Your body is designed to be particularly resilient. Your chassis is medium armor in the plate armor group that grants a +4 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of +1, a check penalty of -2, a speed penalty of -5 feet, and a Strength value of 16. You can never wear other armor or remove your chassis; however, you still don't become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} from sleeping. Finally, you can etch armor runes onto your chassis as normal.

Enhancement Your chassis becomes difficult to overcome. You gain the Chassis Deflection reaction.

entries.name: Relentless Disarm
entries.description:
When you succeed, but don't critically succeed, at a check to Disarm a creature, your circumstance bonus to further checks to Disarm that creature is +4 instead of +2. Other creatures gain only the normal bonus.

When you critically succeed at a Disarm check, you can immediately Demoralize your target as a reaction.

entries.name: Relentless Wings
entries.description: Your wings are now a permanent part of your physiology. You gain the effects of Fiendish Wings at all times, rather than just once per day for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Reliable Luck
entries.description: You have gone well past nine lives to survive danger with surprising regularity. You can use @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.7qBuzHY8kEG8SdEP]{Cat's Luck} once per hour, rather than once per day.

entries.name: Reloading Trick
entries.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements You’re holding an unloaded hand crossbow.

You can fire off a single shot even when unprepared. You Interact to reload your hand crossbow and Strike with it.

Special If you have the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.HvPvyeXM2iMK4OYf]{Repeating Hand Crossbow Training} feat, you can use this feat with a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.zcrIuILnp6oh4dr9]{Repeating Hand Crossbow} to load either a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.AITVZmakiu3RgfKo]{Bolt} or a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.9w8MrBhFtvM7RrYN]{Magazine}, but the speed means you can fire only one bolt, then the magazine jams. You must spend a 3-action Interact activity to remove the jammed magazine and clear it before it can be used again.

entries.name: Remember Your Training
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

During your training to become a Pathfinder Agent you were schooled on a wide variety of creatures you might encounter, and you can think back to that training to gain crucial insight in times of need. Attempt a check to Recall Knowledge about a creature you can see, adding your level as a proficiency bonus if you are untrained (rather than 0). If you roll a failure (but not a critical failure) on this check, you get a success instead.

entries.name: Reminder of the Greater Fear
entries.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger Another creature within 30 feet of you that can see you would gain the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition.

You give a target a stern glower to remind them that it is you, and no one else, they should truly fear. Reduce the value of the frightened condition the creature would take by 1.

entries.name: Remorseless Lash
entries.description: You're skilled at beating a foe when their morale is already breaking. When you succeed at a melee weapon Strike against a @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} foe, that foe can't reduce their frightened condition below 1 until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Remote Trigger
entries.description:
You've learned how to trigger snares from afar, creating ranged hazards to assail your opponents and allowing you to disarm enemies' snares harmlessly.

You can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strike} a snare to trigger it prematurely. If you crafted the snare, you automatically hit. If someone else crafted it, attempt a ranged Strike against the Crafting DC, triggering the snare only if you hit.

entries.name: Renewing Quills
entries.description: Your spines grow back much faster than other shisks. You can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.oAWNluJaMlaGysXA]{Barbed Quills} reaction once every 10 minutes.

entries.name: Repair Module
entries.description:
Frequency once per day

You trigger your body’s repair programming, causing your body’s nanites to heal your wounds. You gain fast healing equal to half your level for 1 minute. While Repair Module is active, you can’t use other abilities that require the use of your nanites.

entries.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow Training
entries.description:
You become trained in the @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.zcrIuILnp6oh4dr9]{Repeating Hand Crossbow} and gain access to repeating hand crossbows and @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.oJZe5rRitvioUgRh]{Shootist Bandolier}. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the repeating hand crossbow. If you’re at least an expert in a repeating hand crossbow you’re using, you gain access to its critical specialization effect. You can perform the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.hV9wXLvgH2LBaBwk]{Shootist's Draw} action with repeating hand crossbows.

Special If you have the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.meQJfsKVar9tm6c9]{Running Reload} feat, you can reload a repeating hand crossbow @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.9w8MrBhFtvM7RrYN]{Magazine} on the move. You can use Running Reload as a 3-action activity to reload a magazine into a repeating hand crossbow after you Stride, Step, or Sneak, or as a 2-action activity if you use a magazine from a shootist bandolier.

entries.name: Replenishing Hydration
entries.description: You draw life from the water around you. If you submerge in water and rest for 10 minutes, you regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier × half your level .

entries.name: Reptile Rider
entries.description: To you, crocodilians, giant lizards, and dinosaurs are loyal steeds, not monsters. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.Rq5wkA8DtsmbzoGV]{Ride} feat, even if you don’t meet the prerequisites. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to Handle an Animal as long as the animal is a reptile, dinosaur, or even a non-sapient dragon.

entries.name: Reptile Speaker
entries.description: You hear the sounds of reptiles as language. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals that are reptiles (the GM determines which animals count as reptiles).

entries.name: Repurposed Parts
entries.description: You are familiar with the fittings and cogwheels of your snares and can repurpose parts from prepared quick-deploy snares to assemble a new creation on the fly. Using two of the snares you prepared for quick deployment during daily preparations, you can quickly deploy a different snare that you know how to Craft, even if you didn't prepare that snare during your daily preparations.

entries.name: Rescuer's Press
entries.description: Any shield you wield gains the shove trait. When you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} using a shield and @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} as part of that action, you can move an additional 5 feet to either side of the creature you Shoved. In addition, if you are in the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.6GN1zh3RcnZhrzxP]{Everstand Stance} and successfully Shove a creature using a shield that you wield two-handed, you can increase the distance of your Shove to 10 feet.

entries.name: Resilient Shell
entries.description: Your eidolon is resilient against attacks. It gains resistance to physical damage equal to its Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Resist Ruin
entries.description: Your duskwalker heritage allows you to extend protection against negative energy to yourself or an ally in need. You gain resistance 5 to negative energy, and once per day, you can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YvXKGlHOt7mdW2jZ]{Death Ward} as a divine innate spell.

entries.name: Resounding Cascade
entries.description:
Trigger You use Arcane Cascade.

When you enter your Arcane Cascade, you disperse the magical reinforcement to nearby allies. You grant the extra damage of Arcane Cascade in an aura affecting all allies in a 5-foot emanation. This uses only the base damage of the stance, based on the ally's weapon specialization; it doesn't use any increase you get from bonuses, the laughing shadow hybrid study, or the like.

As normal for duplicate effects, multiple Arcane Cascades affecting the same creature aren't cumulative.

entries.name: 臨機応変な儀式使い
entries.description:
前提条件　リチュアリストの専心

君は、技能の埒外であるはずの困難な儀式を発動することが出来る。君は、修得なら、熟練の習熟度を必要とする儀式を発動する判定を試みることが出来る。熟練ならば達人を必要とする、達人ならば伝説を必要とする判定を試みることが出来る。

entries.name: Restitch
entries.description: You've learned how to sew even the most terrible tears and wounds together. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate} as a 7th-level arcane innate spell once per day.

entries.name: Resuscitate
entries.description:
Requirements You are holding healer's tools or are wearing them and have a hand free. Also, the target's body is mostly intact.

You can use Medicine to resuscitate the dead. Attempt a DC 40 Medicine check to revive a dead creature that has been dead for no more than 3 rounds. If you succeed, the target returns to life with the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}, except it still has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition it had before @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, increased by 1 (or wounded 1 if it wasn't wounded before dying). Whether you succeed or fail, the target is temporarily immune to Resuscitate for 1 day.

entries.name: Retain Absorbed Spell
entries.description: When you absorb a spell using the Absorb Spell reaction, you utilize secret, techniques that allow you to retain the power and knowledge necessary to cast the spell repeatedly-potentially for a greater period of time. If you're a spontaneous caster, you can cast the triggering spell up to three times instead of once. If you're a prepared spellcaster, you can replace up to three of your prepared spells of the same level with the absorbed spell instead of one. Either way, you can choose to retain the absorbed spell for the next hour instead of the next 10 minutes; if you choose to extend the absorption to an hour, you can't use Absorb Spell again until one hour after the spell is absorbed.

entries.name: Retractable Claws
entries.description: You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals [[/r 1d4 #slashing]] slashing damage. Your claws are in the brawling group and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits.

entries.name: Return Fire
entries.description:
Requirements You are in @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.YG2RxXE9SMfwo6wP]{Monastic Archer Stance}, are wielding
a bow, and have a free hand.

Snatching an arrow out of the air, you instantly put it to your bow and return fire. When you successfully @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.sgaqlDFTVC7Ryurt]{Deflect an Arrow} as part of that reaction you can immediately make a ranged bow Strike by firing the arrow you deflected from your own bow.

entries.name: Reveal Beasts
entries.description: You are adept at revealing—or creating—weaknesses among those who are a threat to civilization. If you roll a success on a check to Recall Knowledge to identify an animal or a beast, you get a critical success instead. The next time you damage that creature, it gains weakness 5 during that attack to one damage type of your choice that you dealt it.

entries.name: 真名看破
entries.description:
前提条件　〈威圧〉に修得であること、かつ、〈神秘学〉、〈自然〉、〈霊妙学〉、〈宗教〉の1つに修得であること

君は、クリーチャーの真の名前の知識をもって相手を脅し、望み通りにさせる。君はそのクリーチャーの真の名前を知っており、発話し、そのクリーチャーにして欲しいことを言わなくてはならない。対象の意志DCに対して〈威圧〉判定を試みること。

クリティカル その対象は自衛のために、君が言うとおりにするが、いかなる方法でも自分自身を傷つけようとはしない。対象は非友好的（もし既に非友好的や敵対的でないなら）になるが、最大で1日まで従い続ける。対象は君を恐れる余り、報復も逃げることも出来ない。どこへ行こうと君が自分を見つけ出すと確信しているのである

成功 クリティカルと同じだが、ひとたび対象が非友好的になったなら、対象は君を避け、君の敵に君の居場所を警告するなど、間接的なやり方で君に敵対的な行動をする。

失敗 対象は従うことを拒み、一般的には更に真名を使われるのを避けるために君のいないところへ逃亡する。既に非友好的や敵対的でないのなら、非友好的になる。対象は将来においても君を避け、君に対して間接的な行動を取るようになる。

ファンブル 対象は従うことを拒み、既にそうでないなら敵対的になる。もし、対象が君を弱者だと認識しているなら、攻撃するかもしれない；そうでないなら、真名をそれ以上に使われるのを避けるために、君を避ける可能性が高い

entries.name: Revealing True Name
entries.description:
You attempt to get a creature to do as you wish by threatening them with your knowledge of their true name. You must know and speak the creature's true name and say what you want the creature to do. Attempt an Intimidation check against the target's Will DC.

Critical Success The target does as you say out of a sense of self-preservation, and will not harm itself in any way. It becomes unfriendly (if it wasn't already unfriendly or hostile) but continues to comply for up to 1 day. The target is too scared of you to retaliate or flee, certain you would find them wherever they might go.

Success As critical success, but once the target becomes unfriendly, they avoid you and might act against you in an indirect manner, such as alerting your enemies to your location.

Failure The target refuses to comply and typically flees your presence to avoid your further use of their true name. If they were not already unfriendly or hostile, they become unfriendly. They avoid you in the future and are likely to take indirect action against you.

Critical Failure The target refuses to comply and becomes hostile, if it wasn't already. If they perceive you as weak, they might attack you; otherwise, they likely flee to avoid your further use of their true name.

entries.name: Reverse Engineer
entries.description: You are incredibly skilled at reverse engineering items to learn their formulas, or disassembling them just to disable them. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Crafting checks to reverse engineer a formula from an item. If you get a critical success on your Crafting check, you can opt to both create the formula and reassemble the original item at the same time, leaving you with the formula and the item instead of the formula and raw materials equal to half the item's value. Furthermore, you can use Crafting instead of Thievery to Disable a Device or Pick a Lock.

entries.name: 逆分析
entries.description:
前提条件　せびりの達人の専心；〈製作〉に熟練

君は、ほとんどの人間よりも、もっと効率的にアイテムから処方を逆分析することが出来る。君は、アイテムから処方を逆分析するための〈製作〉判定に+2状況ボーナスを得る。

更に、もし、君が〈製作〉判定にクリティカルしたなら、君はただ処方を作り出すだけでなく、同時に元のアイテムを再構成し、その処方とアイテムの価値の半分の原材料が残るのではなく、処方とそのアイテムが残るようにすることが出来る。

entries.name: Revivification Protocol
entries.description:
Frequency once per day
Trigger You have the dying condition and are about to attempt a recovery check.

Your nanites are programmed to automatically revive you. You’re restored to 1 Hit Point, lose the dying and unconscious conditions, and can act normally on this turn. You gain or increase the wounded condition as normal when losing the dying condition in this way.

entries.name: 伝説の跳弾使い
entries.description:
前提条件　《跳弾の達人》

対象との間に障害物があればあるほど、君の弾丸は致命的なものになる。君は対象に命中させるために複数の面で跳弾させるのである。「跳弾射撃」を使う際、君は武器の射程単位の3倍以内にある全ての面で跳ね返らせることが出来る。対象は、全方位の完全遮蔽がない限り、遮蔽の利益を得ることが出来ない。

更に、クリーチャーは君の「跳弾射撃」による攻撃をその遭遇で最初に受ける際に意志セーヴを試みなくてはならない。失敗したなら、クリーチャーは@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{朦朧2}になり、君の射撃がどこを機転としているのか判断することが出来ない。

entries.name: 跳弾の達人
entries.description:
前提条件　《跳弾射撃》

君は角度を見る目があり、他人が不可能だと思うような射撃方法を見つけることが出来る。「跳弾射撃」を使用する際、武器の最初の射程単位以内にある2つの固体の表面に（1つではなく）弾丸を跳ね返らせることが出来る。

更に、クリーチャーは遭遇の間、君が最初に「跳弾射撃」で攻撃した際に @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{立ちすくみ}ある。

entries.name: 跳弾射撃
entries.description: 君は、弾丸を近くの表面に跳ね返し、予想外の角度から相手を攻撃する。火器やクロスボウによる遠隔「打撃」からの遮蔽を判断する際、武器の最初の射程単位内にある固体の表面を1つ選び、弾丸を跳ね返らせることが出来る。その場合、対象の遮蔽は自分からではなく、跳ね返った地点から判断することが出来る。

entries.name: Ricocheting Leap
entries.description: You quickly use your momentum to topple and spring off of foes. You can use Wall Jump to make additional jumps off of creatures larger than you as if they were walls. Once per turn when you make an additional jump off of a creature in this way, you can also attempt to Shove or Trip that creature as a free action.

entries.name: 騎乗
entries.description: 君が移動アクションを取らせるために（「歩行」のような）騎乗している動物に「動物使い」をする際、君は判定を試みる必要なく、自動的に精巧する。君が騎乗しているあらゆる動物は、手下のように君の手番に行動する。もし君が遭遇の最中に動物に「騎乗」するのであれば、それは次の手番をスキップし、それから君の次の手番に行動する。

entries.name: Riftmarked
entries.description: Long ago, qlippoth marked someone in your lineage, most likely through their ancient runestones that dot Golarion’s surface. Yours is an old lineage, primordial and twisted, and you have a sense for similarly twisted things. You’re trained in Occultism. If you’re already trained in Occultism (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.hDGosy2ZTwnyctEP]{Oddity Identification} skill feat.

entries.name: Right-Hand Blood
entries.description: It’s said that the flesh of the right side of a hyena can heal diseases, but that of the left side is poisonous. You can take [[/r 1 #damage]] damage to feed someone blood from your right side and Administer First Aid or take [[/r 2d8 #damage]] damage to Treat Disease or Treat Wounds; in either case, you don’t need healer’s tools, and gain a +1 item bonus. Blood from your left side causes the check to critically fail automatically.

entries.name: Righteous Resistance
entries.description: You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n]{Resist Energy} twice per day as a divine innate spell, except you can target only yourself. If you grant yourself resistance to fire damage, the resistance is equal to either the spell’s normal value or to your level, whichever is higher.

entries.name: Rimesoul
entries.description: The water inside you is cold and frozen, like sheets of ice and frigid glaciers. You gain resistance to cold equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less severe (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).

entries.name: Rippling Spin
entries.description:
Trigger You are hit by a physical melee attack by an attacker you can see that's in reach.

Requirements You're in Reflective Ripple Stance.

After the triggering attack is done, Step. You must end this Step within the attacker's reach. Then, you can attempt an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the attacker.

entries.name: Riptide
entries.description:
Requirements You are within 10 feet of water at least 10 feet deep, and your Speed is sufficient to reach the water in one Stride.

Trigger You successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature of the same size as you or smaller.

You Stride up to 10 feet to enter the water, bringing the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature with you into the water.

entries.name: 危険な再装填
entries.description:
条件 君が火器を使っている

君は、火器を素早く再装填する技術を鍛えていたが、この技術の使用を試みるのは火器の機能性を犠牲にする危険な賭けである。火器を再装填するための「使用」をし、それからその火器で「打撃」を行うこと。この「打撃」が失敗したなら、火器は不発する。

entries.name: Ritual Reversion
entries.description: You can temporarily revert to a less conspicuous form without diminishing your senses. You take the form of an ordinary specimen of the type of plant or fungus that most closely resembles you, reverting to your body's appearance just before your spirit joined with it. This otherwise has the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{Tree Shape}, except that your size remains Small.

entries.name: Ritualist Dedication
entries.description:
You have begun to master the difficult art of casting rituals. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all primary checks to perform a ritual.

You learn two uncommon rituals with a level no higher than half your level; you must meet all prerequisites for casting the ritual to choose it. At 8th level and every 4 levels thereafter, you learn another uncommon ritual with a level no higher than half your level and for which you meet the prerequisites.

You can cast these as the primary caster, but you can't teach them to anyone else or allow someone else to serve as primary caster unless they know the ritual as well.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the ritualist archetype. If you retrain out of this feat, you lose the rituals learned from it.

entries.name: Roadkill
entries.description:
Requirements You are piloting a vehicle.

In your hands, any vehicle is a weapon. When you use @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.lID4rJHAVZB6tavf]{Run Over}, you can use your class DC in place of the vehicle's collision DC. Your vehicle can Run Over any number of creatures up to one Size smaller than the vehicle or ram any one target creature or object in your path up to the size of your vehicle.

entries.name: 強健
entries.description:
前提条件　〈医学〉に熟練

君は病気や毒から回復する手助けになるような民間医療を学んでおり、それを怠りなく用いることによって特に回復力が高くなっている。君が「病気の手当」や「毒の手当」をする際か、誰かがそれらのアクションを君に使う際、成功が与える状況ボーナスを+4に増加させる。また、もし患者のセーヴィング・スロー結果が成功ならば、患者はクリティカルする。

entries.name: Rockslide Spell
entries.description:
You enhance your spell with elemental earth, causing chunks of stone to litter the ground.

If the next action you use is to Cast a non-cantrip Spell that affects an area, a number of 5-foot squares in the area equal to the spell level become difficult terrain for 1 round. These squares must be on the ground, and the entire area of difficult terrain must be contiguous.

The spell gains the earth trait.

entries.name: Rogue Dedication
entries.description:
You gain a skill feat and the rogue's surprise attack class feature. You become trained in light armor. In addition, you become trained in Stealth or Thievery plus one skill of your choice; if you are already trained in both Stealth and Thievery, you become trained in an additional skill of your choice. You become trained in rogue class DC.

Special You cannot gain another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the rogue archetype.

entries.name: Rokoan Arts
entries.description: Ancestral spirits have begun to bond themselves to you, granting you powers characteristic of a rokoa. You can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C]{Speak with Animals} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HTou8cG05yuSkesj]{Status} as primal innate spells once per day each.

entries.name: Rope Mastery
entries.description: Ropes are your tool of choice, and you deploy them in versatile ways. When Climbing a rope, you move 5 more feet on a success and 10 more feet on a critical success, to a maximum of your Speed. This additional movement stacks with the effects of Quick Climb. In addition, you can use a rope to hamper your foes. When holding a rope, you can attempt an Athletics check to Disarm, Grapple, or Trip a creature up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. If you critically fail such a check while holding a rope, you can drop the rope to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

entries.name: 綱渡り
entries.description:
前提条件　海賊の専心；〈軽業〉と〈運動〉に修得

君はロープや索具を、地面と同じように簡単に走り、登ることが出来る。君は15フィートの登攀@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{登攀}速度を得るが、これは船の索具や似たようなロープの上でだけである。

君がロープの「登攀」のための〈運動〉やロープで@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{「バランスを取る」}ための〈軽業〉に成功した際、代わりにクリティカルする。君はロープの上での「登攀」や「バランスを取る」間、@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{立ちすくみ}にならない。

entries.name: Rough Terrain Stance
entries.description:
Requirements You gained a terrain attunement benefit this turn.

You enter a stance that makes it difficult to move around you. Each square adjacent to you becomes difficult terrain that matches the terrain attunement you gained (rime forms in an arctic terrain, momentary undergrowth shoots up in a forest terrain, and so on). You ignore this difficult terrain.

This stance ends if you move into a different type of terrain.

entries.name: Ru-shi
entries.description: You were born to a jiang-shi, one of the so-called hopping vampires found most often in Tian-Xia. Your parent had a supernatural obsession with counting small objects, which manifests in you as a preternatural gift for linguistics and mathematics. You are trained in Society and gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.0N8TtGSk5enoLBZ8]{Eye For Numbers} skill feat. If you would automatically become trained in Society (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

entries.name: Rubbery Skin
entries.description: Your skin develops a malleable, rubbery quality. You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage equal to 2 + your number of class feats from the oozemorph archetype. You also gain resistance equal to twice that amount to extra damage from critical hits; if the resistance is greater than the extra damage, it reduces the extra damage to 0 but doesn't reduce the attack's normal damage.

entries.name: 頼もしい生存上手
entries.description:
前提条件　剣の達人の専心；〈生存〉に達人

君は、「剣の学院」の専門家と共に〈生存〉技術を学び、荒野で長時間、過ごすことに慣れている。陸路での移動中に降雨量のせいで疲労が早くなることはないが、それ以外の場合には通常通りに疲労する。君は、渇きからダメージを受けることなく、3+耐久力修正値に等しい日数、過ごすことが出来る。また、君は飢餓からダメージを受けることなく、5+耐久力修正値に等しい日数、過ごすことが出来る。

entries.name: Rule of Three
entries.description:
Requirements You have @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.hPZQ5vA9QHEPtjFW]{Spun a Tale}.

Trigger The villain of the tale you've spun makes an attack roll with a given weapon or unarmed attack, uses a particular special ability (such as a Breath Weapon), or Casts a Spell against the hero, and they used that same attack, special ability, or spell against the hero on the previous turn.

Heroes learn from their previous failures, often succeeding on the third attempt. You narrate a tale of the hero's success, granting them a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC or saving throw against the triggering effect. If the villain has used the same effect against the hero on both of their last two turns, and you used Rule of Three on that effect last turn as well, the bonus increases to +4.

entries.name: Runelord Dedication
entries.description:
Your rune magic increases, and you practice with your school's associated weapon. You gain an additional cantrip of your chosen arcane school, and each time you gain a level (including this level), you add an additional spell from your chosen arcane school to your spellbook, with the same restrictions as the two spells you normally add.

Special You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the runelord archetype.

entries.name: Runescarred Dedication
entries.description:
Archetype @Compendium[pf2e.archetypes.RyjrUkqSIg52Mjl8]{Runescarred}

Access You are from the Saga Lands.

Whether through blood (if you're Varisian, Shoanti, or New Thassilonian) or by exposure to rune magic, you have become runescarred, with visible, glowing runes on your body in the form of tattoos or scars. You might have possessed these marks before gaining the archetype, but you only truly became runescarred when you chose to study and tap into the runes' power. You become an expert in Arcana and you also become trained in Thassilon Lore, or an expert in Thassilon Lore if you were already trained in it.

Choose one cantrip from the arcane list. One of the runes on your body corresponds to the chosen cantrip, and you can cast the chosen cantrip as an innate arcane spell.

Special You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the runescarred archetype.

entries.name: Runic Impression
entries.description:
You can temporarily replicate the effects of a property rune for your weapon or unarmed attacks. You learn the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.oOaEfsdVpgTXRhrY]{Runic Impression} conflux spell.

Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

entries.name: Running Tackle
entries.description: You charge toward your opponent, throwing your body at them in a vicious tackle. Stride up to your Speed and then make an unarmed melee Strike. If you hit, you can attempt to Shove the target.

entries.name: Runtsage
entries.description: Unlike most of your kind, who dismiss goblins as embarrassments or expendable annoyances, you have studied the methodology behind their irresponsible and incomprehensible actions. You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.ihN8gkHSdPG9Trte]{Adopted Ancestry} general feat and must select goblin as the feat’s chosen ancestry. You also gain one 1st-level goblin ancestry feat.

entries.name: Saber Teeth
entries.description: You have long fangs, natural or augmented. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals [[/r 1d6 #piercing]] piercing damage. Your jaws are in the brawling group and have the unarmed trait.

entries.name: Sacred Ki
entries.description:
The power of your faith suffuses your ki. When you select this feat, choose chaos, evil, good, or law. Your choice must match one of your deity's alignment components.

When you cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.ZL8NTvB22NeEWhVG]{Ki Strike} focus spell and damage a creature whose alignment is opposite your chosen alignment, you can choose for the ki strike damage to be of the chosen type.
